text.0: here is the gear for friction here tinder made ready for the spark.
text.1: bring thou the matron we will rub agni in ancient fashion forth.
text.2: n the two firesticks jātavedas lieth even as the wellset germ in pregnant women.
text.3: agni who day by day must be exalted by men who watch and worship with oblations.
text.4: lay this with care on that which lies extended straight hath she borne the steer when made prolific.
text.5: with his red pillarradiant is his splendourin our skilled task is born the son of iḷā.
text.6: in iḷās place we set thee down upon the central point of earth.
text.7: that agni jātavedas thou mayst bear our offerings to the gods.
text.8: rub into life ye men the sage the guileless immortal very wise and fair to look on.
text.9: o men bring forth the most propitious agni first ensign of the sacrifice to eastward.
text.10: when with their arms they rub him straight he shineth forth like a strong courser red in colour in the wood.
text.11: bright checkless as it were upon the aśvins path he passeth by the stones and burneth up the grass.
text.12: agni shines forth when born observant mighty the bountiful the singer praised by sages.
text.13: whom as adorable and knowing all things gods set at solemn rites as offeringbearer.
text.14: set thee o priest in thine own place observant lay down the sacrifice in the home of worship.
text.15: thou dear to gods shalt serve them with oblation agni give long life to the sacrificer.
text.16: raise ye a mighty smoke my fellowworkers ye shall attain to wealth without obstruction.
text.17: this agni is the battlewinning hero by whom the gods have overcome the dasyus.
text.18: this is thine ordered place of birth whence sprung to life thou shonest forth.
text.19: knowing this agni sit thee down and prosper thou the songs we sing.
text.20: as germ celestial he is called tanūnapāt and narāśaṁsa born diffused in varied shape.
text.21: formed in his mother he is mātariśvan he hath in his course become the rapid flight of wind.
text.22: with strong attrition rubbed to life laid down with careful hand a sage.
text.23: agni make sacrifices good and for the pious bring the gods.
text.24: mortals have brought to life the god immortal the conqueror with mighty jaws unfailing.
text.25: the sisters ten unwedded and united together grasp the babe the newborn infant.
text.26: served by the seven priests he shone forth from ancient time when in his mothers bosom in her lap he glowed.
text.27: giving delight each day he closeth not his eye since from the asuras body hewas brought to life.
text.28: even as the maruts onslaughts who attack the foe those born the first of all knew the full power of prayer.
text.29: the kuśikas have made the glorious hymn ascend and each one singly in his home have kindled fire.
text.30: as we o priest observant have elected thee this day what time the solemn sacrifice began.
text.31: so surely hast thou worshipped surely hast thou toiled come thou unto the soma wise and knowing all.
